Flub.Name: Style
Flub.Description: The style of the crack pattern generated by the node.

Flub.Name: Normal
Flub.Description: The default style that creates cracks that gentle slope inward.

Flub.Name: Hard
Flub.Description: The edges of the cracks are not refined and may show aliasing. This may be useful if the softer edges create artifacts in other nodes.

Flub.Name: Classic
Flub.Description: The default style from previous versions of Gaea. This is creates very thin cracks without a slope curve.

Flub.Name: Octaves
Flub.Description: The number of crack pattern sets to generate.

Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: The overall size of the cracked pattern.

Flub.Name: Depth
Flub.Description: The depth of the cracks. It also widens the cracks.

Flub.Name: Jitter
Flub.Description: Control the offset of the cracks between symmetrical and chaotic.

Flub.Name: Warp Strength
Flub.Description: The strength of the warp distortion applied to the cracks.

Flub.Name: Warp Size
Flub.Description: The size of the warp distortion applied to the cracks.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Scale X
Flub.Description: The non-uniform scale on the X axis.

Flub.Name: Scale Y
Flub.Description: The non-uniform scale on the Y axis.
